page.title: 05MID-SUSSEX EMPLOYMENT (1)
page.content: The Lewes Road Sawmill in Scaynes Hill has been in operation since 1710.At first it was a family business,now it is owned by Cotswald Building ltd,the manager is Mr T Budgen.It has 33 employees and uses 3 lorries.They buy their wood from 2 or 3 importers and use wood such as Canadian cedar and Swedish wood which comes in a raw state.From this he makes extensions, sheds,chalets and greenhouses.The high grove chalet is the most popular product.They do not export their goods although they used to.In the last year they have had 3 accidents but for 15 years before they had none.As they store a lot of wood there is a great fire risk so there are many hoses and extinguishers.When they order wood they state what size they want,they get some in metres cubed and cedar comes in standard(metric).
